Ad Text:
We currently have an opportunity for a Data Manager in Canberra or Melbourne to work on Land projects.


Join our Downer Professional Services team and play a key role in delivering complex defence and national security projects that safeguard Australia's future.



Downer Professional Services comprises of three business units our Technical, Advisory, and Capability consulting practice, and Team Downer, which partners with CASG and NSSG as a major service provider to Defence. Together, we are a multi-disciplinary advisory and delivery partner of choice for clients across Defence and National Security.



We currently have an opportunity for a Data Manager in Canberra or Melbourne to work on Land projects.



What You'll Do


This role offers a broad scope, with key role responsibilities including:




Data & Information Management: Develop, maintain, and improve processes for storing, sharing, and managing project data using Defence systems (Objective, SharePoint, DOORS, Teams).





Quality & Compliance: Support Project Quality Management Systems (QMS) and ensure compliance with ISO 9001:2015 standards.





Technical Support & Training: Provide assistance and training to project personnel on applications, online systems, and data management practices.





Governance & Reporting: Prepare briefs, reports, and submissions for governance forums, while coordinating project and contract meetings.





Stakeholder & Procurement Engagement: Collaborate with Defence, industry, and contractors to manage procurement activities, evaluate responses, and build effective stakeholder relationships.



What You'll Bring





Data Management Expertise: Demonstrated experience as a Data Manager (or similar) on complex, highly technical Defence capability projects.





Quality & Compliance Knowledge: Strong understanding of Defence Quality Management Systems (QMS) and ISO 9001 standards.





Systems & Tools Proficiency: High-level experience with Defence information and records management systems such as Objective, SharePoint, DOORS, and Predict.





Workflow & Documentation Control: Proven ability to develop and manage document workflows, ensuring version control and chain of custody.





Stakeholder & Communication Skills: Effective collaboration in complex stakeholder environments, with advanced technical writing and strong verbal communication skills.




Due to the nature of the work, you are required to currently hold and maintain a minimum Negative Vetting 1 or higher Security clearance as required by the Commonwealth. In some instances, compliance with International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) requirements may also be an inherent requirement.


More than anything, you'll bring a strong work ethic, a positive attitude, and a commitment to delivering high-quality outcomes for our clients.



Why Downer Professional Services


At Downer Professional Services, we're not just a workplace - we're a business dedicated to contributing to the shaping of the future of defence in Australia. As the country's only sovereign prime, we're committed to making a real difference in protecting Australia's interests.



What is means to belong at Downer Professional Services








Meaningful work: Help to deliver critical Defence projects that protect Australia and shape its future.



Professional development: Access career mapping, accelerated learning programs, and shared learning through our Communities of Practice.



Great perks: Enjoy discounts on healthcare, retail, vehicles, and more through Perks@Downer.



Veteran support: Benefit from initiatives like up to 20 days of Reservist Leave to stay connected post-service.



You want your work to matter and so do we. With over 26,000 people across Australia, New Zealand and the Pacific, our team is made up of individuals with unique perspectives, backgrounds, and ideas.

We know that diversity makes us stronger and we actively celebrate it through our commitment to inclusion and belonging.



We're committed to building a team that reflects the diverse communities we serve and we welcome people of all ages, genders, sexual orientations, cultures, abilities, and lived experiences. We especially encourage applications from those whose voices have traditionally been underrepresented in our industry, including women, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples, Māori and Pasifika Peoples, veterans, people with disability, and neurodivergent individuals. Even if your experience doesn't align perfectly with this role, we'd still like to hear from you. If it feels like the right fit, apply - potential counts, and so do you.



As a WORK180 Endorsed Employer, we support flexibility that works for your life, inclusive leadership that values your voice, and equitable access to opportunity so you can do your best work and bring your whole self to it.




If you need support or adjustments through the recruitment process, just let us know, we're here to help you put your best foot forward.

Aurelia Metals Limited is an ASX-listed, Australian-owned gold and base metals company based in NSW. We operate the Peak and Federation underground mines and are progressing the Great Cobar Project, a high-grade copper development near Peak.

We are proud to be a WORK180 endorsed employer, with inclusion, safety, and our Values at the heart of everything we do. With one of the most prospective land positions in the Cobar Basin, we are unlocking value through discovery, development, and growth.

The Great Cobar Project, with an eight-year mine plan and strong exploration upside, will drive the next generation of growth at Aurelia and create diverse career pathways for those wanting to be part of a high-performance, forward-thinking culture.




About the role 

We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Financial Planning and Analysis Manager to join our team. Reporting directly to the Chief Financial Officer, this is a highly visible role where you will act as a trusted advisor, bringing clarity, insight, and thoughtful challenge to support strategic decision-making across the business.

In this role, you will manage the FP&A function, providing high-quality financial and economic insights that support business planning, growth initiatives, and key projects across the Company. While the role has no direct reports, you will lead through influence, partnering closely with leaders and the executive team to drive alignment and deliver meaningful outcomes.

You are someone who brings both strong technical capability and a collaborative approach, with the ability to translate complex financial information into clear, practical insights. Your experience in financial planning and analysis, ideally within the resources sector, will enable you to provide accurate and timely guidance that supports confident decision-making.

With a naturally engaging communication style and strong commercial awareness, you build trusted relationships across all levels of the organisation. You are comfortable balancing strategic thinking with hands-on delivery and thrive in an environment where you can make a genuine impact.

 

Roster: Monday to Friday (travel to site required)

Location: Brisbane CBD




Key responsibilities 

Lead the Group planning cycle, including life of mine plans, annual budgets, and forecasts

Develop and maintain robust Life of Mine Plan models, supporting sites with their own models

Consolidate operational submissions and present outcomes to the leadership team and Board

Conduct detailed analysis and scenario modelling on group performance, cash flow, and commodity price sensitivities

Manage the Group planning system (Workday Adaptive), including ongoing development and enhancements

Coordinate risk assessments at each stage of the planning cycle

Oversee capital governance, including approval processes and intra-year forecasts

Deliver financial analysis (variance, trends, benchmarking) to support reporting and cost-saving opportunities

Manage the group cash flow model and provide regular updates to leadership, Board, and financiers

Provide financial modelling and analysis for ad hoc projects, supporting Technical Services and Growth teams

Support major contract tenders through financial evaluation

Monitor external analyst coverage and identify opportunities to align market forecasts with Aurelia’s messaging




Qualifications and experience

Tertiary qualification in business, finance, or a mining-related discipline

Proven experience in corporate planning, financial modelling, and investment analysis within complex environments

Strong understanding of mining processes and value chain interdependencies

Advanced Excel and financial modelling skills

Familiarity with Power BI, QlikView, or Workday Adaptive (desirable)




MAKE AN IMPACT, GET RECOGNISED – BE AN AURELIAN

At Aurelia Metals, our people are at the heart of everything we do. We reward hard work, support growth, prioritise wellbeing, and foster a culture where everyone belongs, because when you thrive, we thrive.

What we offer

Reward & Recognition: Competitive pay, incentives, share plans and recognition programs

Lifestyle Balance: Family-friendly rosters, 18 weeks paid parental leave, health perks, counselling and flexible work options

Purpose & Community: Values-driven culture, WORK180 Employer of Choice, relocation support and local housing benefits

Development & Progression: Training and development, apprenticeships, graduate programs and clear career pathways




Our recruitment process
We are committed to a fair, accessible, and transparent process, using structured interviews and work-ready checks. If you require support or adjustments, please let us know during initial screen.

What to expect

Application review – we assess applications as they are received

Initial screen – a short call with our HR team

Structured interview – with a technical leader and HR representative

Work-ready checks – may include police clearance, pre-employment medical, references and/or skills testing

Offer – a formal offer made to the successful candidate




Ready to get started? Simply hit the apply now button!

We actively promote a culture where everyone feels safe, included and respected. We welcome differences of thought and people from all backgrounds as we strive to create a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace.

Position: Associate Director 
Salary: 200,000
Company: Advisory 
Location: Australia 
Projects: Renewable Energy

 Join a high performing environment to develop solutions, accelerate energy transition, and grow your industry expertise under the guidance of senior leaders experienced in addressing major strategic challenges in electricity markets. Play a key role in all aspects of client engagement: identifying issues, forming hypotheses, conducting analysis, synthesising conclusions into recommendations, managing workstreams and projects, and driving internal initiatives.

Responsibilities: 
Team Management- Provide direction and oversight across multiple assignments while mentoring analysts and technical specialists. You will foster a culture of accountability, collaboration, and continuous improvement, supporting professional growth and maintaining high performance standards.
Engagement Management - Translate client priorities into structured project scopes, define deliverables, and ensure execution is aligned with agreed timelines and budgets. 
Business Development - Build and sustain strong relationships with stakeholders, becoming a trusted advisor. You will contribute to expanding the client base by identifying opportunities and supporting tenders. 

Experience:

Over 5 years within the power or electricity sector, developed through advisory, public sector, regulatory, or commercial roles.
Experience applying quantitative tools and modelling techniques to derive meaningful market or policy insights
Strong analytical judgement applied to strategic and commercial challenges within evolving energy systems.
Experience contributing to revenue growth through proposal writing, relationship development, and proactive business generation
